title: Flu Shot Information and Appointments
author: Government Websites by CivicPlus
cleaned_text: Regular dose for those 6 months to 64 years of age High dose for those 65 years old and over: Currently out of stock Mercury and preservative free quadrivalent flu vaccine will be available for adults and children and high-dose flu vaccine will be available for those 65+. If you do have health insurance, please bring your health insurance or Medicare card. COVID-19 vaccine appointments cannot be accommodated at the flu clinic. Payment Information Regular Dose Flu Vaccine $25 High Dose Flu Vaccine $73 Administrative Fee (for accepted insurance) $20 Same-day Administrative Fee (for payment by cash, check or card) $5 Accepted Insurance BlueCross BlueShield Cigna First Choice of the Midwest First Health Network Medicare Mountain Health Co-Op Wyoming Medicaid Importance of Getting Vaccinated Against the Flu Influenza is a serious disease that can lead to hospitalization and sometimes even death. Every flu season is different and influenza infection can affect people differently. Because of the COVID-19 pandemic, getting a flu vaccine is more important than ever and will help protect yourself, your family and your community. When more people get vaccinated against the flu, less flu can spread through that community. Flu Shots at Other Pharmacy's Albertsons:Appointments for regular and high dose flu shots are now available and walk-ins are being accepted. Smith's:Appointments for regular and high dose flu shots are available.
